A Fleet Testing Mod (v0.3.0)
items.summary: Adds several Console Commands commands to help with campaign fleet testing and analysis. Also includes a MagicLib bounty in Asharu featuring a [REDACTED] test fleet.
items.description:
Adds several Console Commands commands to help with campaign fleet testing and analysis. Also includes a MagicLib bounty in Asharu featuring a [REDACTED] test fleet. 

*v0.3.0 Patch Notes*
```
* Updated to Starsector 0.97

* Added "AddPresetOfficer" command, which can spawn preset officers from a JSON file

* "InitiateFleetTest" now also clears the player inventory; adds max supplies, crew, and fuel; and repairs the fleet/ship

* Added another MagicBounty for dueling against a single Remnant ship

* Reduced likelihood the testing bounties will be shown over other bounties
```
```Save-compatible```

AI Tweak for High Energy Focus
Add Stable Locations using Console Commands
Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: **A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**
items.description:
**A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**

Requires MagicLib and LazyLib.

Install and press J in combat, in refit, or on the world map to open a GUI.

Features:
- Many tags, such as targeting or avoiding shields, PD mode and many many more
- GUI-based configuration in combat/refit or on the campaign map
- Tags are automatically saved between combats and reloads
- Seamlessly switch between simple mode (6 tags) and advanced mode (over 20 tags)
- Customize AI-controlled ship behavior through ship modes in advanced mode
- Create your own default tags with the option to automatically apply them
- Customize most aspects of the mod through an extensive settings file
- Manually control multiple weapon groups at once using the Merge tag

Can be updated/added/removed to/from ongoing campaigns.

```
To mod-authors:
If you want to integrate with AGC to improve ship/weapon AI behavior of your faction, check the readme. Feel free to ping me if you need help or want to request a special mode.
Example integration code: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-symbiotic-void-creatures/blob/main/src/tecrys/svc/hullmods/BGECarapace.kt#L98
```

Videos:
AGC in 60s: https://youtu.be/2T3xNqy2HQA
AGC in-depth (long and rambly, watch at 1.5~2x speed and/or use chapters): https://youtu.be/WRH66z4EYcc
AGC showcase (slightly outdated): https://youtu.be/Zg4sxRj9V8I

Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21280.0
Download: https://github.com/DesperatePeter/starsector-advanced-weapon-control/releases

items.summary:
Library for mod developers allowing for secondary ship systems to be added during combat that can be activated using keys defined through LunaLib.
` `
items.description:
Library for mod developers allowing for secondary ship systems to be added during combat that can be activated using keys defined through LunaLib.
` `
Requires MagicLib, LazyLib, and LunaLib. Mods using this are Exotica Technologies, Random Assorted Things, and Apex Design Collective. If you're a mod author and I missed your mod, let me know.

Changelog:
```
v1.1.2 - drone activators now spawn all drones at start of combat without consuming charges. this means they'll start with full charges, which (iirc) is the same as drone systems in vanilla.
v1.1.1 - ship timeflow mult is now taken into account when advancing activators
v1.1.0 - added drone activators
```

**Download:** https://github.com/scardwell15/combatactivators/releases/download/v1.1.2/Combat-Activators-v1.1.2.zip

items.name: Demto's Ship Pack 1.2.0 - 0.97 release
items.summary: A small mod with a couple of ships and fighters, made by a mysterious stranger.
items.description:
A small mod with a couple of ships and fighters, made by a mysterious stranger.  

Balance feedback appreciated!

Download link:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B1CYK2tklzy41qZBaoz0F8ShUivpk41E/view?usp=drive_link

Changelog:
```Changes:
- Added the Keythong-class artillery cruiser. Fielded exclusively by the Church to bolster their lines with LIDAR-boosted long-range barrages. Slow, but capable of battering enemies before they can even think of fighting back.
- Added the Mothman-class phase cruiser. A heavy composite-component craft exclusively assembled at Kapteyn Starworks, featuring a vast ballistics-focused frontal battery supplemented by torpedoes and the ability to deploy phase-barriers. 
- Added the Minesweeper-class frigate. A small weapon platform specialized in point-defense escort duty.
- Added the Petard-class heavy bomber. An incredibly dangerous pirate bomber corvette that lugs four heavy guided fuel bombs to its target.
- Added the Wasp (P) class bomber. Fast and more fragile than the actual payload itself, pirate-modified Wasps are disposable in every way possible.
- A bunch of uh, stat tweaks to some existing content that I forgot to properly log. Vanguard-Orion, Herbert and Angst are a bit tankier, Stormsprite is a bit less silly.
```
Credits to Nia's Dakkaholics and Trailer Moments for the first banner image. I, uh, couldn't be bothered to turn it off, and the Hellbore sprite just looks several times better than the vanilla one anyway.

items.summary: Ever felt the Sindrian Diktat was too weak as a faction? Then this mod's just the thing for you!
items.description:
Ever felt the Sindrian Diktat was too weak as a faction? Then this mod's just the thing for you!

This mod considerably buffs up the Sindrian Diktat to somewhere between Tri-Tachyon and PL/Hegemony level of size and power. This mod gives them a new system and new markets + lots of other things. Now, they hopefully won't get folded in 2 cycles with Nex enabled, and can even hold their own against the superpowers of the Sector!

*Diktat Enhancement 1.2.2b - quick and dirty hot fix + various changes*

items.name: Domain Explorarium Expansion
items.summary:
An in-development mod focused around the Domain Exploration Derelicts, the green droneships you fight early in the game... and also the Abyss apparently. Currently adds about 60 new automated ships and several types of derelict fighters to the game that are hopefully worth actually adding to your fleet. 
```
items.description:
An in-development mod focused around the Domain Exploration Derelicts, the green droneships you fight early in the game... and also the Abyss apparently. Currently adds about 60 new automated ships and several types of derelict fighters to the game that are hopefully worth actually adding to your fleet. 
```
Changelog:
Version 0.0.16- Gaze Into The Abyss
-These change notes are reconstructed as the originals were lost, keep that in mind if you find undocumented features.
-Compatability with version 0.97 of Starsector
-Updated the sprite of the Fort
-Updated the sprite of most Mutant drones, less kitbash, more trash.
-Added the Evergreen, a massive megafreighter found in similar circumstances to other super-supply ships.
-Added Heavy Ballistic Integration to the Battlement, a small band-aid to help it with its' OP problems
-Reworked the Berserker 2, now with added support missiles.
-Reworked the Bersillion, now with heavy ballistic capability.
-Added the Penitent, a Pather-modified Redstone with a taste for triple hammer barrages.```
Can this mod be added to an existing save?```
 YES! And you will *not* miss any content by doing so.
```Is this save compatable with previous versions of this mod?```
 YES!

Emergent Threats
items.summary: A mod for Starsector that makes the Remnant and Sindrian Diktat more challenging to fight. Also adds new ships, boss bounties, weapons, hullmods, and the IX Battlegroup hostile faction.
items.description:
A mod for Starsector that makes the Remnant and Sindrian Diktat more challenging to fight. Also adds new ships, boss bounties, weapons, hullmods, and the IX Battlegroup hostile faction.

The mod is split into two parts, the core Emergent Threats, and the ET: IX Revival faction submod (the 9th Domain Battlegroup was originally created by Inventor Raccoon for Arsenal Expansion, and is re-added with permission). The two parts interact with each other but can be used separately.

v0.5.0 github direct link: https://github.com/vice-grip/starsector-mod-emergent-threats/releases/download/v0.5.0/EmergentThreats_v0.5.0.zip

This mod adds a scrollbar to the industry screen, so you can have as many buildings on one planet as you want. 

There is a 10% compounding upkeep penalty per building over the limit (can be disabled). Read the FAQ!

items.summary: Mod library with numerous graphical effects.
items.description:
Mod library with numerous graphical effects.

GraphicsLib is a mod package containing numerous graphical improvements, including a variety of effects plugins, a dynamic lighting engine, and a screen-space distortion shader.  This library can also be used by other modders to implement unique shaders and make use of the built-in lighting, distortion, and post-processing APIs.

items.name: Gundam UC Mod v0.5.1 GP Quick Fix!
Halo HomeSystems
items.summary:
COMPATABILITY 
 -Is compatible with Nexerelin.
items.description:
COMPATABILITY 
 -Is compatible with Nexerelin.
-NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ORIGINAL OR EXPANDED UNSC MOD.

FEATURES:
Adds two factions: the UNSC, and the Covenant.

The Covenant is a high tech and late-game faction to the game to the south east of the core worlds comprising 5 planets (sizes 9, 8, 7, 6, 6). Ships all have high flux cap and dissipation, but Covenant weapon flux usage is correspondingly high, take care when using these weapons on other craft, but have low(ish) armour and hull. EVERYONE HATES THE COVENANT.
Ships have a very high cost, default ships tend to accumulate flux quickly-ish even when firing and not taking damage.

The UNSC is a midline mid-late game faction northeast of the core worlds comprising 3 planets. Ships all have at least 1 axial ballistic shield-breaking MAC and love missiles and ballistic weapons. Especially hates the Covenant, and has actual relations with other factions unlike the Covenant.

HULLMODs:
- Shield with code taken from Star Wars mod (I hope that's ok)
- Hullmods from original UNSC mod.

Assets taken from UNSC mod by AppleMarineXX and expansion by StargazerRJL mainly for weapons and some Covenant ships.
Sprites taken from Halo wiki and free-to-access artworks on Artstation by Jared Harris (most sprites from here).
Other sprites made using AI (since I can't art).

Hardpoint sprites will be added once ships are more balanced (and possibly downsized).

items.name: Illustrated.Entities
items.summary: `Change your colony descriptions and illustrations.`
items.description:
`Change your colony descriptions and illustrations.`

Adds images to all vanilla planets, a way to change them, 500+ AI-generated illustrations to choose from for your own colonies, and allows you to edit and add descriptions to your own planets with an in-game UI.

VRAM-Impact is around 70 mb during normal gameplay because the mod only loads images that you look at. 
However, it cannot un-load them, so VRAM use can be up to 250mb depending on your actions. Restarting the game will clear the image cache.

```Changelog:
1.2.b
Adjusted - Version Number (wow!)
1.2.a
Fixed all the problems with images not getting saved or overwritten, proper handling for orbital stations, and some crash fixes.``````diff

items.name: Independent Interstellar
items.summary:
Adds more-militarized weapons of pirate mk2 ships, and a couple "what-if?" weapons.
Not balanced and i didn't even attempt.
items.description:
Adds more-militarized weapons of pirate mk2 ships, and a couple "what-if?" weapons.
Not balanced and i didn't even attempt.
```yaml
Ships added:
- Atlas mk2 (II)
- Colossus mk3 (II)
- Mudskipper mk2 (II)
They have more armor, more OP and militarized reactors, but very little storage, and less acceleration. They are added as Independent ships, not pirate!

Weapon variants added:
- Devastator Cannon: version without range issues, version with regenerating charges, and version with both.
- Hellbore Cannon: proximity shell version (Reaper sized explosion).
- Plasma Cannon: single shot version.
- HAG: version that deals less direct damage, but some guaranteed armor damage.

Hullmods added:
- High Spectal Amplifier: same as HSA, but also +100% to all beam PD deapon damage.
- Auxiliary Ablative Armor: turns ship armor ablative, for a lot of OP. Weaker than Invictus's armor but also isn't quite as weak to AP.
- Rapid Phase Coils: Feel like Sierra on steroids. x5 speed while phased. x4 phase flux usage. Cruisers and Capitals only.
- Advanced Weapon Support: +75% damage and +300 range for weapons that go on slots bigger than the weapon.
```
Download: https://github.com/PrincessOfEvil/Independent-Interstellar/archive/refs/tags/0.4.3.zip
Image:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/PrincessOfEvil/Independent-Interstellar/master/graphics/mudskipper.png

This means: The mod can't be added if it was not present on game start, but the update is safe to install over the old one if you started the save with IndEvo 3.3 present.
```

items.name: Interstellar Imperium
items.summary: Roman-themed (ahistorical) faction of gold-hued ships, ruled by AI gods.
items.description:
Roman-themed (ahistorical) faction of gold-hued ships, ruled by AI gods.

- Powerful frontal batteries, but vulnerable from behind
- Good hull and armor strength, but usually slower and less maneuverable
- Focus on tactics and formations
- Some weapons have extreme ranges (short and long)
- Flexible weapon slots, above-average slot count, fewer larger slots
- Unmatched design flexibility; Imperial Package hull mods drastically affect a ship's role
- Ship systems are altered by Imperial Package choice

items.description:
## LOST_SECTOR
Content Expansion
A mod focused on exploration and quest content
```
     - New corp faction
     - New AI exploration enemy
     - Questline
          - Enemy Unknown
          - Hostile Takeover
          - Operation : Lifesaver
          - The Delve
     - Custom bounties
          - The Peacekeepers
          - Enigma Commander Umbra
          - Project Helios Remnant
          - Void Group Fragment
     - Exploration content
     - Misc vanilla+ content
    
     - CAN BE added mid save
     - Requires LazyLib, MagicLib, GraphicsLib
     - Supports LunaLib, Nexerelin, Exotica Technologies
```
FAQ:
- "How do I start the questline?"
     - Talk to Jack Lapua on Asteria in Arcadia system, requires 20+ rep with Kesteven
- "Kesteven only has one market?"
     - Their main planet is Asteria in the Arcadia star system
- "What do I do with Artifact Electronics?"
     - You can trade them in at Asteria for Prototype ships and weapons after staring the second quest, or just sell them for cash.
- "Does this mod work mid save?"
     - Yes, everything will automatically generate as if you started a new save.

items.name: Leading Pip
items.summary: Adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.
items.description:
Adds a target leading pip in front of whatever ship you have targeted.

If you shoot at that pip, you will generally hit the target.  The algorithm takes into account your position and velocity, your target's position and velocity, your weapon group, the positions of the weapons in the weapon group, and the projectile speed of the weapons in the weapon group.  Sometimes the target will be going too quickly to have any hope of hitting it, in which case the reticle may behave oddly, but this is rare.

Download: https://bitbucket.org/DarkRevenant/leading-pip/downloads/Leading_Pip_1.9.4.7z
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=7921.0

items.description:
**Orbital Defense**: a defense oriented bar mission.
**Repair Mission**: companion mission to repair your orbitals faster after it gets blown up
**Mercantile Convoy Escort**: Join trade fleets instead of ignoring them or hunting them down like pirates.
**VIP mission**: add mission to distress calls to make it worthwhile
**Scavenger Trading**: Trade with salvage fleets (including scavengers and prospectors) for salvage intel or swap commodities.
**Pick Your Ships**: New game choice that allows you to pick your starting ships
**Force Auto Resolve**: If your fleet is much bigger than the enemy, adds an option to auto resolve battles even if enemy is not interested in fleeing.

items.name: Musashi Manufactorum
items.summary: Battleship in space! They are based from various battleships such as Yamato, Iowa, Richelieu. Their sizes are not proportional to each other as you can see. I try my best to make them balance while enjoyable as artillery ship. The name are based on Japanese deities and folklore. Hope you guys enjoy it.
items.description:
Battleship in space! They are based from various battleships such as Yamato, Iowa, Richelieu. Their sizes are not proportional to each other as you can see. I try my best to make them balance while enjoyable as artillery ship. The name are based on Japanese deities and folklore. Hope you guys enjoy it. 

The ships are mostly appears in pirate/independent/mercs fleets and black markets. Their blueprints are spread around vanilla blueprints package and musashi unique packages.

items.name: Pirate Mini Mod
items.summary:
I always feel that once you hit a certain point you are no longer really surprised by pirates.
Their roster is limited and their few ships are either weak or just repaints of existing hulls. This alongside mod power creep often renders the faction a minor annoyance or time sink even in the mid game.
items.description:
I always feel that once you hit a certain point you are no longer really surprised by pirates.
Their roster is limited and their few ships are either weak or just repaints of existing hulls. This alongside mod power creep often renders the faction a minor annoyance or time sink even in the mid game.

This is a mod meant to make pirates more unique, unhinged, and ambitious. As of now changes are simple but I plan to evolve the mod over time as I learn or get help.


Download: https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1R5I_kJijUMsJBkFODWmfcNewr6rGjADJ
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=27893.0

items.name: Pirate Ransom - Bribe Pirates to avoid combat
Price of Command 0.0.8
items.summary: Allows your officers to get tired, get injured, and, in the worst case, **die**. ` `
items.description:
Allows your officers to get tired, get injured, and, in the worst case, **die**. ` `

To compensate for the increased demands this puts on your officers, officers are now cheaper to hire, pay, and are more numerous. Additionally, you can now have a greater number on your roster.
Mod authors may be interested in implementing their own "conditions" like fatigue and injuries. A number of methods are available for other mod authors to hook into.
```
Requires:
LazyLib, MagicLib, LunaLib
Optional:
Console Commands - Lets you inflict and heal the conditions currently in the mod, as well as just kill an officer (but why?)
```
***Not balanced AT ALL***
***Not save compatible AT ALL with versions prior to 0.0.5***

**Changelog:**
```
0.0.8 BETA
- Injuries avoided by a successful roll on the crew survival stat would be lost and not resolve correctly, resulting in a permanent bugged Injury skill and a permanently missing actual skill
  - I recommend installing Console Commands and giving your officers a free skill if you believe you've been impacted
- The table detailing officer conditions in the After Action Report will no longer extend out of frame when officers have longer names
0.0.7 BETA
- Base roster size configurable through LunaLib
- Conditions resolving no longer causes a crash (oops)
0.0.6 BETA
- 0.97 compatibility
0.0.5 BETA
Features:
- Scars now do something
  - Officers may now be more cowardly or reckless when facing certain adversaries...
- More configs
- Crew loss reduction multipliers (ie: Blast Doors) should now reduce the chance of officers being injured. Or, this being a beta and my brain being fried on a Sunday night, it will crash your game.
- Maybe other stuff? I don't remember
- lots and lots of bug fixes
- oh probably a very annoying option that will break your muscle memory in fleet encounter dialogs
NOT SAVE COMPATIBLE WITH VERSION PRIOR TO 0.0.5
```
Download: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/price-of-command/releases/download/0.0.8/price-of-command.zip>

items.name: Random Weapon Collection
items.summary:
Adds a few weapons and some ships I wanted to make.
Still under construction, but releasing so people can try them out.
items.description:
Adds a few weapons and some ships I wanted to make.
Still under construction, but releasing so people can try them out.

Contains:
Egret- Midline capital carrier very similar to the Heron
Onslaught (B)- Onslaught variant with a beam TPC.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.

Devastation- Large slot HE ballistic weapon.   Will show up in mercenary fleets occasionally.
Mjolnir Heavy Cannon- Triple-barrel Mjolnir, good luck finding something with the flux to use this well. 
Autopulse Beam- Designed as a shitpost, is just an Autopulse Laser that was turned into a beam weapon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Plasma Beam- Similar to the Autopulse Beam, but based on the Plasma Cannon.  Does not spawn in NPC fleets/markets currently.
Tachyon Accelerator- Projectile variant of Tachyon Lance.  Does not pierce shields.  


Can be added mid-playthrough and should function correctly if done.

If you have a good idea for something I should add, let me know.  I might make it.  Maybe.
Balance feedback is appreciated
Known issues:
-Due to Persean League doctrine, the Egret will rarely spawn in faction stores.
-The Onslaught variant is terribly balanced.  This is fine. 
-Sounds for the beam weapons are terrible.  Will be fixed in a future release.

Forum link: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=28822.0

```Changelog:
0.0.5
Added the Tachyon Accelerator, a large slot energy weapon similar to the Tachyon Lance.  Has no shield-penetrating effect.
Added onhit effect to Tachyon Accelerator.  
Compatibility with 0.97.  To use with 0.96 (or 0.95), edit the mod_info.json.
Save Compatible
Version 0.0.6
Updates Onslaught (B) sprite to match updated Onslaught, and properly centers the right builtin weapon slot.
Updates Egret sprite, large mount should no longer be blurry.
```
Download Link: https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1203054429927120996/1203471629842251786/random_weapon_collection.zip

items.name: Refit Filters
items.summary: A Hullmod that filters weapons according to certain characteristics.
items.description:
A Hullmod that filters weapons according to certain characteristics.

Adds a single new hullmod that applies filters to the refit weapon menu. A Spiritual successor to ruddygreat's Filter Hullmods.

The following filters are currently implemented.
- Damage type
- Range
- Beam / Projectile
- Point Defense / Non Point Defense

items.name: Ruthless Sector
items.summary:
Provides difficulty options meant to incentivize challenging gameplay.
Full description: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=15279.0>
items.description:
Provides difficulty options meant to incentivize challenging gameplay.
Full description: <https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=15279.0>

Latest changes:
```fix
- Updated for Starsector 0.97a
- New behavior with default settings:
   - For games started without Nex or the tutorial, you start at a random colony
   - More factions will be hostile at the start of new games
   - Hostile factions will be chosen so that your relations align with the faction that owns the colony you start at
   - The accessibility penalty for hostilities with other factions is limited to 50%
- Added new settings for randomizing or specifying a starting location for games started without Nex or the tutorial
- Added new settings for improved control over reputation overrides
- Added a setting to control how much accessibility may be reduced due to hostilities with other factions

items.name: Ship Browser 1.2
items.summary: Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.
items.description:
Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.

Some commands include:

**ShipBrowser**
Opens a gui ship browser that's organised by mod and ship class. The gui opens after the console is closed.

**CloneShip <shipNumber> [numberOfClones]**
Creates a copy of a specified ship in the player fleet. "shipNumber" is the order that ships appear in the refit screen. For example the fifth ship from the top in the refit sceen would be ship number 5. "numberOfClones" is a number that defaults to 1 if not specified.

**FindSystemsWithTags <manditory1stTag> [optionalAdditionalTags]**
List the star systems with all of the tags specified in the arguments. A list of tags can be found in com.fs.starfarer.api.impl.campaign.ids.Tags of the StarSector API. Input the string that corresponds to the tag obtained by viewing Constant Field Values. Can be used to find hypershunts and remnants

**AddDMods <shipSelection> <numDmods>**
Adds "numDmods" dmods to the ships specified by "shipSelection". "NumDmods" is a number. "shipSelection" can be a number (eg. 5), a range (eg, 5-10) or the word all. The numbers in "ShipSelection"  corresponds to the order ships appears in the fleet or refit screen. For example the fifth ship in the refit screen is ship 5.

A full list of commands can be found on the forum post. Note that some of the fleet editing commands don't work while the refit screen is open for some reason. No clue why

Download: https://github.com/itBeABruhmoment/ShipBrowser/releases/download/1.2/ShipBrowser1.2.zip
Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26261.msg390257#msg390257

items.name: Small tweaks to Recovery Shuttles / Rugged Construction / Solar Shielding
SpeedUp
items.summary: Hold the middle mouse button and the game becomes 2x faster.  Controls are fully customizable.
items.description:
Hold the middle mouse button and the game becomes 2x faster.  Controls are fully customizable.

Ever wish the game would go by quicker while you're flying your lumbering Paragon up to the line of battle?  Ever wanted to push "fast forward" while your fleet mopped up the remnants of an enemy fleet?  Ever wanted to speed through a trivial Derelicts fight?  This mod is for you!

You can also press the caps lock key to toggle fast mode at your leisure.  The B button toggles the slow-down effect of phase systems.  Control-capslock toggles the game to run in as-fast-as-possible mode.  You can even set custom time scaling factors on separate inputs, if you like.

Download: https://bitbucket.org/DarkRevenant/speedup/downloads/SpeedUp_1.0.1.7z
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=13394.0

WhichMod
items.summary: Tells you what mod something is from. Has several options to enable it for hullmods or to use abbreviations instead of the full mod name.
items.description:
Tells you what mod something is from. Has several options to enable it for hullmods or to use abbreviations instead of the full mod name.

Note that due to coding limitations, ship skins from different mods will be labeled with the mod that the hull is from. For example, if Mod A adds a skin of a ship from Mod B, WhichMod will label it as from Mod B. If the base hull is from vanilla, WhichMod will not label it.

Direct Download: https://github.com/theDragn/whichmod/releases/download/1.2.2/WhichMod_v1.2.2a.zip
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=22367.0
